definition: lit. a dog who catches mice (idiom)/fig. to be meddlesome
dog/CL:隻|只[zhi1],條|条[tiao2]
(coll.) to catch/to seize
(literary) to arrest/to seize/to overtake/until

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
rat/mouse/CL:隻|只[zhi1]
female chicken crows at daybreak (idiom); a woman usurps authority/women meddle in politics/The female wears the trousers.
lit. to point at the chicken while scolding the dog (idiom)/fig. to make indirect criticisms
to beat a dog and bully its owner/fig. to humiliate sb indirectly by bullying a subordinate
can't recognize tall or short (idiom); doesn't know what's what
lit. a dog who catches mice/to be meddlesome (idiom)
lit. the dog that bites doesn't show its teeth (idiom)/fig. the most sinister of people can look quite harmless
pinyin: yao3 ren2 de5 gou3 bu4 lou4 chi3

definition: to talk provokingly or nonsensically
garrulous and sharp-tongued
a dog threatens based on master's power (idiom); to use one's position to bully others
to offend people with unkind remarks (idiom)
fierce
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
vicious talk/malicious tongue
slut/tramp (old)
to stir up trouble (idiom)/to sow discord
to blot out one's conscience
